result.execSummary:
The defendant Brooke Anne Hartwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment; not voluntarily quit employment without agent approval.
Defendant eligible for expungement if she has no new arrests and cases and she successfully completes probation.

Undergo an AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations.

Comply with any no contacts ordered by agent.

Comply with any rules, conditions and programming ordered by agent.

Obtain housing suitable to agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Defendant has 43 days of sentence credit (25 days to be applied to conditional jail time and remaining 18 days credit to be applied to count 1 if probation is revoked).
